Weekly Activity February 21st

Project Activity

This week our primary focus is preparing for the midterm presentation. We have scheduled a presentation with the eStudio for Wednesday. The rest of the time will be spent working on finalizing design details for the project and presentation.

Michael Ho

The past week, I spent more time learning about how to inter-mingle the technologies together. One case is whether to use promises or generators for asynchronous tasks. I plan on coding out the adapter so that ember can talk to the NodeJS back-end.

Rebekah Dale

This past week I collaborated with Joey on the calendar page and familiarized myself with Ember. In the upcoming week, I plan to continue last week's projects and finalize the designs to be presented on March 7th.

Kevin Landwehr

This week we meet more than once as a team to go over our midterm presentation. We have gotten a lot accomplished and the app is progressing nicely. I was also given multiple data examples from Nick Such and was able to construct a MySQL database and ER diagram. I will be usign the ER diagram during our presentation on Wednesday to discuss how each entity and relationship contribute to the flow of the app and makes it flexible to change later on. This week was one of the most productive in terms of actually establishing a foothold into the app beyond just its design. In the coming weeks I expect that the database will be fully integrated with our app and the data flow will be smoothed out.

Joey Williams

This week I will be continuing to work on the calendar page. I have been working through issues getting third party tools integrated with ember. After I resolve these, the calendar should be finished relatively quickly. Once Michael gets the routing set up to communicate with Kevin's database, we can begin learning how to populate the calendar with events. Rebekah and I are also working on finishing the technical design for the front end.
